meanings.sent1: The cake was divided into a decile, with each piece being the same size.
meanings.sent2: In the game, each player received a decile of the total points available.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the hostess cleverly cut the pizza into a decile to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent4: The decile of sunlight that peeked through the clouds illuminated the garden beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The decile of the pie that I got had the perfect amount of filling.

meanings.definition: A value that divides a set of data into ten equal parts
meanings.sent1: The decile of the test scores showed a clear distribution among the students.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used the decile to analyze the income distribution in the population.
meanings.sent3: The decile of shoe sizes in the store made it easy for customers to find their fit.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reached the decile of happiness as she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The decile of rainfall in the region determined the agricultural planning for the season.
